arm_group.description: Implanted with implantable defibrillator or pacemaker system

brief_summary.textblock:
SCORE is an active, prospective, non-randomized, multi-center outcome-oriented registry of
      patients implanted with St Jude Medical (SJM) market-released cardiac rhythm management
      (CRM) products. This registry will be conducted in the United States (US).

      The primary purpose of the registry is to evaluate and publish acute and long-term
      performance of market-released SJM CRM products by analyzing product survival probabilities.
      Product status and any related adverse events will be collected to measure survival
      probabilities.

clinical_study.brief_title: St. Jude Medical Product Longevity and Performance (SCORE) Registry

criteria.textblock:
Enrollment Criteria:

          -  Patient has a standard indication for a CRM implantable device.

          -  Patient is implanted with at least one new market-released SJM CRM product from a
             list provided by SJM (e.g pacemaker, ICD, CRT-D, CRT-P, pacing/sensing lead,
             defibrillation lead) within the last 90 days.

          -  Complete system implant information (e.g. model, serial number, location) is
             available at enrollment.

          -  Any product-related adverse event information at implant is available at enrollment.

          -  Patient or appropriate legal guardian is willing to provide authorization for
             registry participation.

study_pop.textblock:
Any patient indicated for a cardiac rhythm management (CRM) product like ICD, pacemaker,
        CRT-D, CRT-P, leads, etc. would be eligible for participation in the study.

clinical_study.official_title: St. Jude Medical Product Longevity and Performance (SCORE) Registry

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
